channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Lana: A Language-Capable Navigator for Instruction Following and Generation
item.description: Recently, visual-language navigation (VLN) -- entailing robot agents to follow navigation instructions -- has shown great advance.

item.title: DiffusionAD: Denoising Diffusion for Anomaly Detection
item.description: We introduce a new pipeline, DiffusionAD, to anomaly detection.

item.title: BEVHeight: A Robust Framework for Vision-based Roadside 3D Object Detection
item.description: In essence, instead of predicting the pixel-wise depth, we regress the height to the ground to achieve a distance-agnostic formulation to ease the optimization process of camera-only perception methods.

item.title: Dually Enhanced Propensity Score Estimation in Sequential Recommendation
item.description: According to the graph, two complementary propensity scores are estimated from the views of item and user, respectively, based on the same set of user feedback data.

item.title: Interpretable Ensembles of Hyper-Rectangles as Base Models
item.description: A new extremely simple ensemble-based model with the uniformly generated axis-parallel hyper-rectangles as base models (HRBM) is proposed.

item.title: PoseRAC: Pose Saliency Transformer for Repetitive Action Counting
item.description: Moreover, we introduce a pose-level method, PoseRAC, which is based on this representation and achieves state-of-the-art performance on two new version datasets by using Pose Saliency Annotation to annotate salient poses for training.

item.title: Cascaded Zoom-in Detector for High Resolution Aerial Images
item.description: Detecting objects in aerial images is challenging because they are typically composed of crowded small objects distributed non-uniformly over high-resolution images.

item.title: Mirror: A Natural Language Interface for Data Querying, Summarization, and Visualization
item.description: We present Mirror, an open-source platform for data exploration and analysis powered by large language models.

item.title: Sensitivity-Aware Visual Parameter-Efficient Tuning
item.description: Visual Parameter-Efficient Tuning (VPET) has become a powerful alternative for full fine-tuning so as to adapt pre-trained vision models to downstream tasks, which only tunes a small number of parameters while freezing the vast majority ones to ease storage burden and optimization difficulty.

item.title: Micro-video Tagging via Jointly Modeling Social Influence and Tag Relation
item.description: Existing methods mostly focus on analyzing video content, neglecting users' social influence and tag relation.

item.title: Predicting Individualized Effects of Internet-Based Treatment for Genito-Pelvic Pain/Penetration Disorder: Development and Internal Validation of a Multivariable Decision Tree Model
item.description: In this study, we developed and internally validated a multivariable decision tree model that predicts effects of an internet-based treatment on a multidimensional composite score of GPPPD symptoms.

item.title: Graph-less Collaborative Filtering
item.description: Motivated by these limitations, we propose a simple and effective collaborative filtering model (SimRec) that marries the power of knowledge distillation and contrastive learning.

item.title: MSeg3D: Multi-modal 3D Semantic Segmentation for Autonomous Driving
item.description: We propose a multi-modal 3D semantic segmentation model (MSeg3D) with joint intra-modal feature extraction and inter-modal feature fusion to mitigate the modality heterogeneity.

item.title: Active Teacher for Semi-Supervised Object Detection
item.description: In this paper, we study teacher-student learning from the perspective of data initialization and propose a novel algorithm called Active Teacher(Source code are available at: \url{https://github. com/HunterJ-Lin/ActiveTeacher}) for semi-supervised object detection (SSOD).

item.title: Harnessing Low-Frequency Neural Fields for Few-Shot View Synthesis
item.description: We further propose a simple-yet-effective strategy for tuning the frequency to avoid overfitting few-shot inputs: enforcing consistency among the frequency domain of rendered 2D images.

item.title: DualFair: Fair Representation Learning at Both Group and Individual Levels via Contrastive Self-supervision
item.description: Algorithmic fairness has become an important machine learning problem, especially for mission-critical Web applications.

item.title: Rethinking Optical Flow from Geometric Matching Consistent Perspective
item.description: In this paper, we propose a rethinking to previous optical flow estimation.

item.title: Learning Accurate Template Matching with Differentiable Coarse-to-Fine Correspondence Refinement
item.description: To tackle the challenges, we propose an accurate template matching method based on differentiable coarse-to-fine correspondence refinement.

item.title: Exploiting 4D CT Perfusion for segmenting infarcted areas in patients with suspected acute ischemic stroke
item.description: CT Perfusion (CTP) is often used as a primary assessment to determine stroke location, severity, and volume of ischemic lesions.

item.title: SpiderMesh: Spatial-aware Demand-guided Recursive Meshing for RGB-T Semantic Segmentation
item.description: For semantic segmentation in urban scene understanding, RGB cameras alone often fail to capture a clear holistic topology, especially in challenging lighting conditions.

item.title: DeepMIM: Deep Supervision for Masked Image Modeling
item.description: Deep supervision, which involves extra supervisions to the intermediate features of a neural network, was widely used in image classification in the early deep learning era since it significantly reduces the training difficulty and eases the optimization like avoiding gradient vanish over the vanilla training.

item.title: BiFormer: Vision Transformer with Bi-Level Routing Attention
item.description: As the core building block of vision transformers, attention is a powerful tool to capture long-range dependency.

item.title: DiffBEV: Conditional Diffusion Model for Bird's Eye View Perception
item.description: Diffusion models naturally have the ability to denoise noisy samples to the ideal data, which motivates us to utilize the diffusion model to get a better BEV representation.

item.title: Knowledge Distillation from Single to Multi Labels: an Empirical Study
item.description: Knowledge distillation (KD) has been extensively studied in single-label image classification.

item.title: Mining False Positive Examples for Text-Based Person Re-identification
item.description: Text-based person re-identification (ReID) aims to identify images of the targeted person from a large-scale person image database according to a given textual description.

item.title: Watch or Listen: Robust Audio-Visual Speech Recognition with Visual Corruption Modeling and Reliability Scoring
item.description: Thus, we firstly analyze that the previous AVSR models are not indeed robust to the corruption of multimodal input streams, the audio and the visual inputs, compared to uni-modal models.

item.title: HYBRIDFORMER: improving SqueezeFormer with hybrid attention and NSR mechanism
item.description: SqueezeFormer has recently shown impressive performance in automatic speech recognition (ASR).

item.title: Unsupervised Contour Tracking of Live Cells by Mechanical and Cycle Consistency Losses
item.description: For quantitative evaluation, we labeled sparse tracking points along the contour of live cells from two live cell datasets taken with phase contrast and confocal fluorescence microscopes.

item.title: CoordFill: Efficient High-Resolution Image Inpainting via Parameterized Coordinate Querying
item.description: Thanks to the proposed structure, we only encode the high-resolution image in a relatively low resolution for larger reception field capturing.

item.title: Sr-init: An interpretable layer pruning method
item.description: Our SR-init method is inspired by the discovery that the accuracy drop due to stochastic re-initialization of layer parameters differs in various layers.

item.title: Parametric Surface Constrained Upsampler Network for Point Cloud
item.description: Designing a point cloud upsampler, which aims to generate a clean and dense point cloud given a sparse point representation, is a fundamental and challenging problem in computer vision.

item.title: Quaternion Orthogonal Transformer for Facial Expression Recognition in the Wild
item.description: Firstly, to reduce redundancy among features extracted from pre-trained ResNet-50, we use the orthogonal loss to decompose and compact these features into three sets of orthogonal sub-features.

item.title: Hyperspectral Image Segmentation: A Preliminary Study on the Oral and Dental Spectral Image Database (ODSI-DB)
item.description: Visual discrimination of clinical tissue types remains challenging, with traditional RGB imaging providing limited contrast for such tasks.

item.title: DBSCAN of Multi-Slice Clustering for three-order Tensor
item.description: Several methods for triclustering three-dimensional data require the cluster size or the number of clusters in each dimension to be specified.

item.title: Automated Ensemble Search Framework for Semantic Segmentation Using Medical Imaging Labels
item.description: Reliable classification and detection of certain medical conditions, in images, with state-of-the-art semantic segmentation networks, require vast amounts of pixel-wise annotation.

item.title: Automated Self-Supervised Learning for Recommendation
item.description: This does not generalize across different datasets and downstream recommendation tasks, which is difficult to be adaptive for data augmentation and robust to noise perturbation.

item.title: Diversity-Aware Meta Visual Prompting
item.description: We present Diversity-Aware Meta Visual Prompting~(DAM-VP), an efficient and effective prompting method for transferring pre-trained models to downstream tasks with frozen backbone.

item.title: V2V4Real: A Real-world Large-scale Dataset for Vehicle-to-Vehicle Cooperative Perception
item.description: To facilitate the development of cooperative perception, we present V2V4Real, the first large-scale real-world multi-modal dataset for V2V perception.

item.title: A CNN Based Framework for Unistroke Numeral Recognition in Air-Writing
item.description: Air-writing refers to virtually writing linguistic characters through hand gestures in three-dimensional space with six degrees of freedom.

item.title: Editing Implicit Assumptions in Text-to-Image Diffusion Models
item.description: Our Text-to-Image Model Editing method, TIME for short, receives a pair of inputs: a "source" under-specified prompt for which the model makes an implicit assumption (e. g., "a pack of roses"), and a "destination" prompt that describes the same setting, but with a specified desired attribute (e. g., "a pack of blue roses").

item.title: Alias-Free Convnets: Fractional Shift Invariance via Polynomial Activations
item.description: Although CNNs are believed to be invariant to translations, recent works have shown this is not the case, due to aliasing effects that stem from downsampling layers.

item.title: Calibrated Teacher for Sparsely Annotated Object Detection
item.description: Recent works on sparsely annotated object detection alleviate this problem by generating pseudo labels for the missing annotations.

item.title: AdPE: Adversarial Positional Embeddings for Pretraining Vision Transformers via MAE+
item.description: A criterion in unsupervised pretraining is the pretext task needs to be sufficiently hard to prevent the transformer encoder from learning trivial low-level features not generalizable well to downstream tasks.

item.title: Blind Video Deflickering by Neural Filtering with a Flawed Atlas
item.description: Prior work usually requires specific guidance such as the flickering frequency, manual annotations, or extra consistent videos to remove the flicker.

item.title: SimFLE: Simple Facial Landmark Encoding for Self-Supervised Facial Expression Recognition in the Wild
item.description: One of the key issues in facial expression recognition in the wild (FER-W) is that curating large-scale labeled facial images is challenging due to the inherent complexity and ambiguity of facial images.

item.title: DynaMask: Dynamic Mask Selection for Instance Segmentation
item.description: The representative instance segmentation methods mostly segment different object instances with a mask of the fixed resolution, e. g., 28*28 grid.

item.title: A Simple Framework for Open-Vocabulary Segmentation and Detection
item.description: We present \ourmodel{}, a simple Open-vocabulary Segmentation and Detection framework that jointly learns from different segmentation and detection datasets.

item.title: SIM: Semantic-aware Instance Mask Generation for Box-Supervised Instance Segmentation
item.description: Weakly supervised instance segmentation using only bounding box annotations has recently attracted much research attention.

item.title: Image Label based Semantic Segmentation Framework using Object Perimeters
item.description: Our new PerimeterFit module will be applied to pre-refine the CAM predictions before using the pixel-similarity-based network.

item.title: Evaluation of ChatGPT as a Question Answering System for Answering Complex Questions
item.description: As ChatGPT covers resources such as Wikipedia and supports natural language question answering, it has garnered attention as a potential replacement for traditional knowledge based question answering (KBQA) models.
